prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing environmental sensor readings:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "Timestamp": ["2025-05-24 10:00", "2025-05-24 10:05", "2025-05-24 10:10", "2025-05-24 10:15", "2025-05-24 10:00", "2025-05-24 10:05", "2025-05-24 10:20", "2025-05-24 10:25"],
    "SensorID": ["S1", "S1", "S1", "S1", "S2", "S2", "S1", "S2"],
    "TemperatureCelsius": [22.5, 22.7, 22.6, 28.0, 21.9, 22.0, 15.0, 22.1],
    "HumidityPercent": [55, 56, 55, 57, 60, 59, 70, 58],
    "AirQualityIndex": [30, 32, 31, 33, 25, 26, 45, 28]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should perform an outlier detection for "TemperatureCelsius": 1) Calculate the mean and standard deviation of "TemperatureCelsius" for all readings. 2) Identify any readings where "TemperatureCelsius" is more than 1.5 standard deviations away from the mean (either above or below). 3) For each such outlier, print the "SensorID", "Timestamp", and the anomalous "TemperatureCelsius" reading. Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, calculate mean and standard deviation for temperature, identify outliers based on the 1.5xSTD threshold, and print the specified details for each outlier.
